During the reign of his brother Vasily I, he took part in the campaigns against Torzhok (1392), Zhukotin (1414), and Novgorod (1417). He was the chief orchestrator of the Muscovite Civil War again

heading: Deaths
txt: Ferdinand, Portuguese prince (b. 1402)

entities.title: Ferdinand the Holy Prince
entities.description: Ferdinand the Holy Prince, sometimes called the "Saint Prince" or the "Constant Prince", was an infante of the Kingdom of Portugal. He was the youngest of the "Illustrious Generation" of 15th-century Portuguese princes of the House of Aviz and lay administrator of the Knightly Order of Aviz.

heading: Deaths
txt: Leonel Power, English composer

entities.title: Leonel Power
entities.description: Leonel Power was an English composer of the late Medieval and early Renaissance eras. Along with John Dunstaple, he was a dominant figure of 15th century English music.

heading: Deaths
txt: Mercurino Gattinara, Italian statesman and jurist (b. 1465)

entities.title: Mercurino Gattinara
entities.description: Mercurino Arborio, marchese di Gattinara, was an Italian statesman and jurist best known as the chancellor of the Holy Roman Emperor Charles V. He was made cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church for San Giovanni a Porta Latina in 1529.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lamoral, Count of Egmont (b. 1522)

entities.title: Lamoral, Count of Egmont
entities.description: Lamoral, Count of Egmont, Prince of Gavere was a general and statesman in the Spanish Netherlands just before the start of the Eighty Years' War, whose execution helped spark the national uprising that eventually led to the independence of the Netherlands.

heading: Deaths
txt: Orlando Gibbons, English organist and composer (b. 1583)

entities.title: Orlando Gibbons
entities.description: Orlando Gibbons was an English composer, virginalist and organist who was one of the last masters of the English Virginalist School and English Madrigal School. By the 1610s he was the leading composer and organist in England, with a career cut short by his sudden death in 1625. As a result, Gibbons's oeuvre was not as large as that of his contemporaries, like the elder William Byrd, but his compo

heading: Deaths
txt: Francesco Sforza Pallavicino, Italian cardinal and historian (b. 1607)

entities.title: Francesco Sforza Pallavicino
entities.description: Francesco Maria Sforza Pallavicino, was an Italian cardinal and historian of the Council of Trent. He used the name Sforza Pallavicino as an author and is often incorrectly identified as Pietro Sforza Pallavicino.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ignatius George II, Syriac Orthodox Patriarch of Antioch (b. 1648)

entities.title: Ignatius George II
entities.description: Ignatius George II was the Patriarch of Antioch and head of the Syriac Orthodox Church from 1687 until his death in 1708.

heading: Deaths
txt: Roger Cotes, English mathematician and academic (b. 1682)

entities.title: Roger Cotes
entities.description: Roger Cotes FRS was an English mathematician, known for working closely with Isaac Newton by proofreading the second edition of his famous book, the Principia, before publication. He also invented the quadrature formulas known as Newton–Cotes formulas, and made a geometric argument that can be interpreted as a logarithmic version of Euler's formula. He was the first Plumian Professor at Cambridge

heading: Deaths
txt: Johann Kuhnau, German organist and composer (b. 1660)

entities.title: Johann Kuhnau
entities.description: Johann Kuhnau was a German polymath, known primarily as composer today. He was also active as a novelist, translator, lawyer, and music theorist, and was able to combine these activities with his duties in his official post as Thomaskantor in Leipzig, which he occupied for 21 years. Much of his music, including operas, masses, and other large-scale vocal works, is lost. His reputation today rests

heading: Deaths
txt: Isaac de Beausobre, French pastor and theologian (b. 1659)

entities.title: Isaac de Beausobre
entities.description: Isaac de Beausobre was a French Protestant churchman, now best known for his two-volume history of Manichaeism, Histoire Critique de Manichée et du Manichéisme.

heading: Deaths
txt: Henry Grey, 1st Duke of Kent, English politician and courtier (b. 1671)

entities.title: Henry Grey, 1st Duke of Kent
entities.description: Henry Grey, 1st Duke of Kent, KG, PC was a British politician and courtier.

heading: Deaths
txt: Frederick Haldimand, Swiss-Canadian general and politician, 22nd Governor of Quebec (b. 1718)

entities.title: Frederick Haldimand
entities.description: Sir Frederick Haldimand, KB was a military officer best known for his service in the British Army in North America during the Seven Years' War and the American Revolutionary War. From 1778 to 1786, he served as Governor of the Province of Quebec, during which time he oversaw military operations against the northern frontiers in the war, and engaged in ultimately fruitless negotiations to establish

entities.title: List of Governors General of Canada
entities.description: The following is a list of the governors and governors general of Canada. Though the present-day office of the Governor General of Canada is legislatively covered under the Constitution Act, 1867 and legally constituted by the Letters Patent, 1947, the institution is, along with the institution of the Crown it represents, the oldest continuous and uniquely Canadian institution in Canada, having ex

heading: Deaths
txt: Giovanni Paisiello, Italian composer and educator (b. 1741)

entities.title: Giovanni Paisiello
entities.description: Giovanni Paisiello was an Italian composer of the Classical era, and was the most popular opera composer of the late 1700s. His operatic style influenced Mozart and Rossini, and his music was championed by Haydn and Beethoven.

heading: Deaths
txt: Odysseas Androutsos, Greek soldier (b. 1788)

entities.title: Odysseas Androutsos
entities.description: Odysseas Androutsos was a hero of the Greek War of Independence.

heading: Deaths
txt: Carl Maria von Weber, German pianist, composer, and conductor (b. 1786)

entities.title: Carl Maria von Weber
entities.description: Carl Maria von Weber was a German composer, conductor, virtuoso pianist, guitarist and critic who was one of the first significant composers of the Romantic era. Best known for his operas, he was a crucial figure in the development of German Romantische Oper.

heading: Deaths
txt: John McDouall Stuart, Scottish explorer and surveyor (b. 1815)

entities.title: John McDouall Stuart
entities.description: John McDouall Stuart, often referred to as simply "McDouall Stuart", was a Scottish explorer and one of the most accomplished of all Australia's inland explorers.

heading: Deaths
txt: Antonio Luna, Filipino general (b. 1866)

entities.title: Antonio Luna
entities.description: Antonio Narciso Luna de San Pedro y Novicio Ancheta was a Filipino army general who fought in the Spanish–American War, Philippine Revolution, and Philippine–American War before his assassination in 1899.

heading: Deaths
txt: Stephen Crane, American poet, novelist, and short story writer (b. 1871)

entities.title: Stephen Crane
entities.description: Stephen Crane was an American poet, novelist, and short story writer. Prolific throughout his short life, he wrote notable works in the Realist tradition as well as early examples of American Naturalism and Impressionism. He is recognized by modern critics as one of the most innovative writers of his generation.

heading: Deaths
txt: Karl Robert Eduard von Hartmann, German philosopher and author (b. 1842)

entities.title: Karl Robert Eduard von Hartmann
entities.description: Karl Robert Eduard Hartmann was a German philosopher, independent scholar and author of Philosophy of the Unconscious (1869).

heading: Deaths
txt: O. Henry, American short story writer (b. 1862)

entities.title: O. Henry
entities.description: William Sydney Porter, better known by his pen name O. Henry, was an American short story writer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Chris von der Ahe, German-American businessman (b. 1851)

entities.title: Chris von der Ahe
entities.description: Christian Friedrich Wilhelm von der Ahe was a German-American entrepreneur, best known as the owner of the St. Louis Brown Stockings of the American Association, now known as the St. Louis Cardinals.

heading: Deaths
txt: Herbert Kitchener, 1st Earl Kitchener, Irish-born British field marshal and politician, Secretary of State for War (b. 1850)

entities.title: Herbert Kitchener, 1st Earl Kitchener
entities.description: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, 1st Earl Kitchener was an Irish-born senior British Army officer and colonial administrator. Kitchener won notoriety for his imperial campaigns, especially his scorched earth policy against the Boers, his expansion of Lord Roberts' internment camps during the Second Boer War and his central role in the early part of the First World War.

entities.title: Secretary of State for War
entities.description: The position of Secretary of State for War, commonly called War Secretary, was a British cabinet-level position which existed from 1794 to 1801 and from 1854 to 1964. heading: Deaths
txt: Rhoda Broughton, Welsh-English author (b. 1840)

entities.title: Rhoda Broughton
entities.description: Rhoda Broughton was a Welsh novelist and short story writer. Her early novels earned her a reputation for sensationalism, which meant her later, stronger work tended to be neglected by critics, although she was described as a queen of the circulating libraries.

heading: Deaths
txt: Will Crooks, English trade unionist and politician (b. 1852)

entities.title: Will Crooks
entities.description: William Crooks was a noted trade unionist and politician from Poplar, London, and a member of the Fabian Society. He is particularly remembered for his campaigning work against poverty and inequality.

heading: Deaths
txt: Georges Feydeau, French playwright (b. 1862)

heading: Deaths
txt: Eric Lemming, Swedish athlete (b. 1880)

entities.title: Eric Lemming
entities.description: Eric Otto Valdemar Lemming was a Swedish track and field athlete who competed at the 1900, 1906, 1908 and 1912 Olympics in a wide variety of events, which mostly involved throwing and jumping. He had his best results in the javelin throw, which he won at the 1906–1912 Games, and in which he set multiple world records between 1899 and 1912. His last record, measured at 62.32 m, was ratified by the

heading: Deaths
txt: Pascin, Bulgarian-French painter and illustrator (b. 1885)

heading: Deaths
txt: Emily Dobson, Australian philanthropist (b. 1842)

entities.title: Emily Dobson
entities.description: Emily Dobson was an Australian philanthropist. She was known for her work supporting women's charities.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Holman, English-Australian politician, 19th Premier of New South Wales (b. 1871)

entities.title: Premier of New South Wales
entities.description: The Premier of New South Wales is the head of government in the state of New South Wales, Australia. The Government of New South Wales follows the Westminster system, with a Parliament of New South Wales acting as the legislature. The Premier is appointed by the Governor of New South Wales, and by modern convention holds office by virtue of his or her ability to command the support of a majority o

heading: Deaths
txt: Nils Olaf Chrisander, Swedish-American actor and director (b. 1884)

entities.title: Nils Olaf Chrisander
entities.description: Nils Olaf Chrisander was a Swedish actor and film director in the early part of the twentieth century.

heading: Deaths
txt: Eleanor Farjeon, Jewish-English author, poet, and playwright (b. 1881)

entities.title: Eleanor Farjeon
entities.description: Eleanor Farjeon was an English author of children's stories and plays, poetry, biography, history and satire. Several of her works had illustrations by Edward Ardizzone. Some of her correspondence has also been published. heading: Deaths
txt: Arthur Biram, Israeli philologist, philosopher, and academic (b. 1878)

entities.title: Arthur Biram
entities.description: Arthur Yitzhak Biram was an Israeli philosopher, philologist, and educator.

heading: Deaths
txt: Harry Brown, Australian public servant (b. 1878)

heading: Deaths
txt: Conway Twitty, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (b. 1933)

entities.title: Conway Twitty
entities.description: Harold Lloyd Jenkins, better known by his stage name Conway Twitty, was an American country music singer. He also had success in the rock and roll, R&B, and pop genres. From 1971 to 1976, Twitty received a string of Country Music Association awards for duets with Loretta Lynn. He was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame and the Rockabilly Hall of Fame.

heading: Deaths
txt: Acharya Kuber Nath Rai, Indian poet and scholar (b. 1933)

entities.title: Acharya Kuber Nath Rai
entities.description: Kuber Nath Rai, also written as Kubernath Ray and Kuber Nath Ray, was a writer and scholar of Hindi literature and Sanskrit.

heading: Deaths
txt: J. Anthony Lukas, American journalist and author (b. 1933)

entities.title: J. Anthony Lukas
entities.description: Jay Anthony Lukas was an American journalist and author, probably best known for his 1985 book Common Ground: A Turbulent Decade in the Lives of Three American Families. Common Ground is a classic study of race relations, class conflict, and school busing in Boston, Massachusetts, as seen through the eyes of three families: one upper-middle-class white, one working-class white, and one working-cla

heading: Deaths
txt: Jeanette Nolan, American actress (b. 1911)

entities.title: Jeanette Nolan
entities.description: Jeanette Nolan was an American actress. Nominated for four Emmy Awards, she had roles in the television series The Virginian (1962–1971) and Dirty Sally (1974), and in films such as Macbeth (1948).

heading: Deaths
txt: Sam Yorty, American soldier and politician, 37th Mayor of Los Angeles (b. 1909)

entities.title: Mayor of Los Angeles
entities.description: The Mayor of the City of Los Angeles is the official head and chief executive officer of Los Angeles, California, United States. The officeholder is elected for a four-year term and limited to serving no more than two terms. heading: Deaths
txt: Mel Tormé, American singer-songwriter (b. 1925)

entities.title: Mel Tormé
entities.description: Melvin Howard Tormé, nicknamed "The Velvet Fog", was an American musician, singer, composer, arranger, drummer, actor, and author. He composed the music for "The Christmas Song" and co-wrote the lyrics with Bob Wells.

heading: Deaths
txt: Don Liddle, American baseball player (b. 1925)

entities.title: Don Liddle
entities.description: Donald Eugene Liddle was an American left-handed pitcher in professional baseball who played four seasons in the Major Leagues for the Milwaukee Braves, New York Giants and St. Louis Cardinals from 1953 through 1956. Born in Mount Carmel, Illinois, he batted left-handed, stood 5 feet 10 inches (1.78 m) tall and weighed 165 pounds (75 kg).

heading: Deaths
txt: Dee Dee Ramone, American singer-songwriter and bass player (b. 1951)

entities.title: Dee Dee Ramone
entities.description: Douglas Glenn Colvin, known professionally as Dee Dee Ramone, was an American musician, singer, rapper, and songwriter best known for being a founding member of the punk rock band Ramones, in which he played bass. heading: Deaths
txt: Jürgen Möllemann, German soldier and politician, 10th Vice-Chancellor of Germany (b. 1945)

entities.title: Jürgen Möllemann
entities.description: Jürgen Wilhelm Möllemann was a German politician of the Free Democratic Party. He served as Minister of State at the Foreign Office (1982–1987), as Federal Minister of Education and Research (1987–1991), as Federal Minister of Economics (1991–1993) and as Vice Chancellor of Germany (1992–1993) in the government of Chancellor Helmut Kohl.

entities.title: Vice-Chancellor of Germany
entities.description: The Deputy to the Federal Chancellor, commonly known as Vice Chancellor (Vizekanzler), is the second highest ranking German cabinet member. The chancellor is the head of government and, according to the constitution, gives this title of deputy to one of the Federal Ministers. It is common that the title is given to the major minister provided by the (smaller) coalition partner.

heading: Deaths
txt: Iona Brown, English violinist and conductor (b. 1941)

entities.title: Iona Brown
entities.description: Iona Brown, OBE, was a British violinist and conductor.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ronald Reagan, American actor and politician, 40th President of the United States (b. 1911)

entities.title: President of the United States
entities.description: The president of the United States (POTUS) is the head of state and head of government of the United States of America. The president directs the executive branch of the federal government and is the commander-in-chief of the United States Armed Forces.

heading: Deaths
txt: Adolfo Aguilar Zínser, Mexican scholar and politician (b. 1949)

entities.title: Adolfo Aguilar Zínser
entities.description: Adolfo Aguilar Zínser was a Mexican scholar, diplomat and politician who served as a National Security Advisor to President Vicente Fox and as a UN Security Council Ambassador in the midst of the US invasion of Iraq.

heading: Deaths
txt: Wee Chong Jin, Singaporean judge (b. 1917)

heading: Deaths
txt: Frederick Franck, Dutch-American painter, sculptor, and author (b. 1909)

entities.title: Frederick Franck
entities.description: Frederick Sigfred Franck was a painter, sculptor, and author of more than 30 books on Buddhism and other subjects who was known for his interest in human spirituality. He was a native of The Netherlands and became a United States citizen in 1945. He was a dental surgeon by trade, and worked with Dr. Albert Schweitzer in Africa from 1958-1961.

heading: Deaths
txt: Edward L. Moyers, American businessman (b. 1928)

heading: Deaths
txt: Jeff Hanson, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (b. 1978)

entities.title: Jeff Hanson
entities.description: Jeff Hanson was a singer-songwriter, guitarist and multi-instrumentalist, whose voice was described in a 2005 Paste review as an "angelic falsetto, a cross between Alison Krauss and Art Garfunkel that is often (understandably) mistaken for a female contralto".

heading: Deaths
txt: Ray Bradbury, American science fiction writer and screenwriter  (b. 1920)

entities.title: Ray Bradbury
entities.description: Ray Douglas Bradbury was an American author and screenwriter. One of the most celebrated 20th-century American writers, he worked in a variety of modes, including fantasy, science fiction, horror, mystery, and realistic fiction.

entities.description: Adnan Ismail Najm al-Bilawi Al-Dulaimi, better known by the nom de guerre Abu Abdulrahman al-Bilawi, was a top commander in the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and the head of its Military Council, prior to his killing by Iraqi security forces on 4 June 2014.

heading: Deaths
txt: Tariq Aziz, Iraqi journalist and politician, Iraqi Minister of Foreign Affairs (b. 1936)

entities.title: Tariq Aziz
entities.description: Tariq Aziz was Iraqi Deputy Prime Minister (1979–2003) and Foreign Minister (1983–1991) and a close advisor of President Saddam Hussein. Their association began in the 1950s when both were activists for the then-banned Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party. He was both an Arab nationalist and an ethnic Assyrian, and a member of the Chaldean Catholic Church.

entities.description: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Iraq is a cabinet ministry of Iraq, responsible for conducting foreign relations of the country.

heading: Deaths
txt: Andy Cunningham, English actor (b. 1950)

entities.title: Andy Cunningham (actor)
entities.description: Andrew Cunningham was an English actor, puppeteer, ventriloquist and writer. He was best known as the creator and main writer of the children's BBC television series, Bodger & Badger, in which he acted as the likeable but accident-prone Simon Bodger and his pet, Badger.

heading: Deaths
txt: Cheick Tioté, Ivorian footballer (b. 1986)

heading: Deaths
txt: Kate Spade, American fashion designer (b. 1962)

entities.title: Kate Spade
entities.description: Katherine Noel Valentine Brosnahan Spade was an American fashion designer and entrepreneur. She was the founder and former co-owner of the designer brand Kate Spade New York.
